text: evabic aims evaluate binary classifiers specifying detected true actually true. dependencies.

title: Evaluation of Binary Classifiers
text: can install evabic CRAN using install.packages("evabic"). Alternatively can grab development version GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("abichat/evabic")

title: Evaluation of Binary Classifiers
text: evabic provides handy functions compute 18 different measures. function begins ebc_*. Available measures include True Positive Rate (Sensitivity Recall), True Negative Rate (Specificity), Positive Predictive Value (Precision), False Discovery Rate, Accuracy, F1… measures computed confusion matrix:
code: evabic::ebc_allmeasures #>  [1] "TP"   "FP"   "FN"   "TN"   "TPR"  "TNR"  "PPV"  "NPV"  "FNR"  "FPR"  #> [11] "FDR"  "FOR"  "ACC"  "BACC" "F1"   "PLR"  "NLR"  "DOR"

title: Evaluation of Binary Classifiers
text: Let’s use evabic toy example. Consider three variables X1, X2 X3, Y variable predicted three variables, 4 conditionally independent variables X4 X7. use linear regression detect actual predictors (select significant variables like home, ’s bad way ). , selected two predictors among three true predictors. Single measures available ebc_*() functions. can also ask several measures single row summary format ebc_tidy(). Note evabic also supports named logicals detected true arguments, must named (see add_names() function needed). ebc_tidy_by_threshold(), can ask evolution measures according moving threshold provide vector p-values (score). makes easy plot various-threshold curves like ROC curve.  finally, can ask AUC, area ROC curve.
code: library(evabic) set.seed(42) X1 <- rnorm(50) X2 <- rnorm(50) X3 <- rnorm(50) predictors <- paste0("X", 1:3)  df_lm <- data.frame(   X1 = X1,   X2 = X2,   X3 = X3,   X4 = X1 + X2 + X3 + rnorm(50, sd = 0.5),   X5 = X1 + 3 * X3 + rnorm(50, sd = 0.5),   X6 = X2 - 2 * X3 + rnorm(50, sd = 0.5),   X7 = X1 - 0.2 * X2 + rnorm(50, sd = 2),   Y = X1 - 0.2 * X2 + 3 * X3 + rnorm(50) ) model <- lm(Y ~ ., data = df_lm) summary(model) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = Y ~ ., data = df_lm) #>  #> Residuals: #>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max  #> -1.66504 -0.65784 -0.05977  0.51720  2.14833  #>  #> Coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    #> (Intercept)  0.13537    0.14528   0.932  0.35678    #> X1           1.35385    0.44929   3.013  0.00437 ** #> X2           0.09974    0.46105   0.216  0.82977    #> X3           3.67893    1.18759   3.098  0.00347 ** #> X4          -0.22998    0.33164  -0.693  0.49183    #> X5          -0.17073    0.30744  -0.555  0.58161    #> X6          -0.04023    0.28381  -0.142  0.88795    #> X7           0.07055    0.09245   0.763  0.44966    #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 1.005 on 42 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared:  0.921,  Adjusted R-squared:  0.9079  #> F-statistic: 69.99 on 7 and 42 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16 pvalues <- summary(model)$coefficients[-1, 4] pvalues #>          X1          X2          X3          X4          X5          X6  #> 0.004366456 0.829771754 0.003469737 0.491828466 0.581608670 0.887948400  #>          X7  #> 0.449664443 detected_var <- names(pvalues[pvalues < 0.05]) detected_var #> [1] "X1" "X3" ebc_TPR(detected = detected_var, true = predictors) #> [1] 0.6666667 ebc_ACC(detected = detected_var, true = predictors, m = 7) # the total size of the set is 7 #> [1] 0.8571429 ebc_tidy(   detected = detected_var,   true = predictors,   m = 7,   # you can use `measures = ebc_allmeasures` to compute all measures   measures = c("TPR", "TNR", "FDR", "ACC", "BACC", "F1") ) #>         TPR TNR FDR       ACC      BACC  F1 #> 1 0.6666667   1   0 0.8571429 0.8333333 0.8 pvalues < 0.05 #>    X1    X2    X3    X4    X5    X6    X7  #>  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ebc_tidy(   detected = pvalues < 0.05,   true = predictors,   m = 7,   measures = c("TPR", "TNR", "FDR", "ACC", "BACC", "F1") ) #>         TPR TNR FDR       ACC      BACC  F1 #> 1 0.6666667   1   0 0.8571429 0.8333333 0.8 df_measures <- ebc_tidy_by_threshold(   detection_values = pvalues,   true = predictors,   m = 7,   measures = c("TPR", "FPR", "FDR", "ACC", "BACC", "F1") ) df_measures #>     threshold       TPR  FPR       FDR       ACC      BACC        F1 #> 1 0.003469737 0.0000000 0.00       NaN 0.5714286 0.5000000 0.0000000 #> 2 0.004366456 0.3333333 0.00 0.0000000 0.7142857 0.6666667 0.5000000 #> 3 0.449664443 0.6666667 0.00 0.0000000 0.8571429 0.8333333 0.8000000 #> 4 0.491828466 0.6666667 0.25 0.3333333 0.7142857 0.7083333 0.6666667 #> 5 0.581608670 0.6666667 0.50 0.5000000 0.5714286 0.5833333 0.5714286 #> 6 0.829771754 0.6666667 0.75 0.6000000 0.4285714 0.4583333 0.5000000 #> 7 0.887948400 1.0000000 0.75 0.5000000 0.5714286 0.6250000 0.6666667 #> 8         Inf 1.0000000 1.00 0.5714286 0.4285714 0.5000000 0.6000000 plot(   df_measures$FPR,   df_measures$TPR,   type = "b",   xlab = "FPR",   ylab = "TPR" ) ebc_AUC(detection_values = pvalues, true = predictors, m = 7) #> [1] 0.75 ebc_AUC_from_measures(df_measures) #> [1] 0.75

title: Area under the curve — ebc_AUC
code: set.seed(42) X1 <- rnorm(50) X2 <- rnorm(50) X3 <- rnorm(50) predictors <- paste0("X", 1:3) df_lm <- data.frame(X1 = X1, X2 = X2, X3 = X3,                     X4 = X1 + X2 + X3 + rnorm(50, sd = 0.5),                     X5 = X1 + 3 * X3 + rnorm(50, sd = 0.5),                     X6 = X2 - 2 * X3 + rnorm(50, sd = 0.5),                     X7 = X1 - X2 + rnorm(50, sd = 2),                     Y  = X1 - X2 + 3 * X3 + rnorm(50)) model <- lm(Y ~ ., data = df_lm) pvalues <- summary(model)$coefficients[-1, 4] ebc_AUC(pvalues, predictors, m = 7) #> [1] 1  df_measures <- ebc_tidy_by_threshold(pvalues, predictors, m = 7) ebc_AUC_from_measures(df_measures) #> [1] 1

title: Available measures — ebc_allmeasures
text: TP True Positive FP False Positive FN False Negative TN True Negative TPR True Positive Rate Sensitivity Recall Power $$TPR = \frac{TP}{TP + FN} = 1 - FNR$$ TNR True Negative Rate Specificity $$TNR = \frac{TN}{FP + TN} =  1 - FPR$$ PPV Positive Predictive Value Precision $$PPV = \frac{TP}{TP + FP} = 1 - FDR$$ NPV Negative Predictive Value $$NPV = \frac{TN}{TN + FN} = 1 - $$ FNR False Negative Rate Type II Error Rate Miss Rate $$FNR = \frac{FN}{TP + FN} = 1 - TPR$$ FPR False Positive Rate Type Errors Rate Fall-$$FPR = \frac{FP}{FP + TN} = 1 - TNR$$ FDR False Discovery Rate $$FDR = \frac{FP}{FP + TP} = 1 - PPV$$ False Omission Rate $$= \frac{FN}{TN + FN} = 1 - NPV$$ ACC Accuracy $$ACC = \frac{TP + TN}{TP + FP + FN + TN}$$ BACC Balanced Accuracy $$BACC = \frac{\frac{TP}{TP + FN} + \frac{TN}{FP + TN}}{2}$$ F1 F1 Score $$F1 = \frac{2 TP}{2TP + FP + FN}                       = \frac{2}{\frac{1}{TPR} + \frac{1}{PPV}}$$ PLR Positive Likelihood Ratio LR+ Likelihood Ratio Positive Results $$PLR = \frac{TPR}{1 - TNR}$$ NLR Negative Likelihood Ratio LR- Likelihood Ratio Negative Results $$NLR = \frac{1 - TPR}{TNR}$$ DOR Diagnostic Odds Ratio $$DOR = \frac{\frac{TP}{FP}}{\frac{FN}{TN}}                        = \frac{PLR}{NLR}$$
